publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1178 Mr Ted Brocklebank: Congratulations to Fife Constabulary-That the Parliament congratulates Fife Constabulary for the successful pilot scheme of housing satellite police stations in rural post offices; notes how this programme has benefited communities in Fife by providing a police presence in remote areas as well as maintaining postal services at a time when many rural post offices are being closed, and hopes that this scheme will be rolled out to other rural areas throughout Scotland.

S2M-1178 Congratulations to Fife Constabulary (lodged on 19 April 2004) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Murdo Fraser*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, John Swinburne*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Christine Grahame*, Mary Scanlon*, Phil Gallie*, Bill Aitken*, Mr David Davidson*
S2M-1178 Congratulations to Fife Constabulary (lodged on 19 April 2004) Dr Jean Turner*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-1178 Congratulations to Fife Constabulary (lodged on 19 April 2004) Alex Johnstone*

S2M-1178 Mr Ted Brocklebank: Congratulations to Fife Constabulary-That the Parliament congratulates Fife Constabulary for the successful pilot scheme of housing satellite police stations in rural post offices; notes how this programme has benefited communities in Fife by providing a police presence in remote areas as well as maintaining postal services at a time when many rural post offices are being closed, and hopes that this scheme will be rolled out to other rural areas throughout Scotland. Supported by: Mr Mark Ruskell, Murdo Fraser, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, John Swinburne, Mrs Nanette Milne, Christine Grahame, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie, Bill Aitken, Mr David Davidson, Dr Jean Turner, Mr Brian Monteith, Alex Johnstone
S2M-1178 Congratulations to Fife Constabulary (lodged on 19 April 2004) Miss Annabel Goldie*
